meanings.definition: To put in danger or at risk.
meanings.sent1: Running in the dark jeopards your safety.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the door unlocked jeopards your belongings.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting your umbrella jeopards getting wet in the rain.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring warning signs jeopards your well-being.
meanings.sent5: Playing with fire jeopards your chances of getting burned.

meanings.definition: A situation involving risk or danger.
meanings.sent1: Crossing the busy street alone is a jeopards.
meanings.sent2: Exploring the abandoned house is a jeopards.
meanings.sent3: Eating spicy food without water nearby can be a jeopards.
meanings.sent4: Walking on thin ice is a jeopards waiting to happen.
meanings.sent5: Not wearing a helmet while biking is a jeopards to your safety.
